post.content:
Following Job just opened in my department. If you are interested, please send your resume and covering letter to me at suh.l@sympatico.ca.

====================================================================
Job title: Engineer/Officer - System Administration
Hours of work: 35.00
Location: 49 Sarjeant Drive, Barrie

General Accountabilities:

System administration of computer systems required for supporting the Integrated Operating Facilities used in the real-time monitoring and control of the Transmission system and Dispatch Operation.
Participate as a member of team responsible for the support and development of the UNIX and Windows 2000 platforms, including:
Developing and implementing new system administration capabilities on the UNIX and Windows 2000 platforms, such as security, monitoring, etc.
Developing and implementing scripts and procedures necessary for the system administration in the disciplined real-time monitoring and control environment.
Developing and implementing system infrastructure elements such as, domains, directory structures etc.
Responding to problems to ensure system continues to provide the control room staff with the required functionality 24 hours a day.

Selection Criteria
Essential Competencies:
Demonstrated strong personal commitment to high quality work and customer satisfaction.
Demonstrated ability to develop and deploy complex real-time systems required for transmission operations and dispatch operations.
Demonstrated ability to work in a project environment, under tight deadlines, interfacing with other project staff, as well as users and project leader.
Demonstrated ability to assess, develop, recommend and implement integrated solutions.
Demonstrated ability to coordinate work with other project staff.
Demonstrated record of self-motivated behaviour and perseverance to accomplish objectives.
Demonstrated ability in planning and maintaining control of quality and work performance.
Demonstrated extensive hands-on experience with life cycle computer systems support.
Professional level of communication skills, both oral and written.
Demonstrated capability to deal with external vendors.
Ability to work effectively as part of a large multi-disciplined team.

Essential knowledge, Experience and Qualifications:
Demonstrated advanced experience in successfully administering a Windows NT/2000/2003/XP environment.
Demonstrated advanced experience in successfully administering a Unix environment will be a significant asset.
Demonstrated experience with monitoring capabilities, such as, onsite manager, HP Openview, etc.
Demonstrated experience with security features of administration.
Demonstrated experience of disciplined administration procedures, such as, source control, release procedures, etc.
Experience with data modeling techniques and modeling software products.
Experience in a real-time control system environment would be an asset.
Requires an advanced knowledge of electrical engineering/computer science subjects and disciplines in order to design, develop and support large-scale real-time and mission critical computer systems. This knowledge is normally acquired through the completion of four years of University training.
An understanding of the software systems used in the monitoring and control of the transmission system and the dispatch operation will be an asset.
An understanding of power system concepts and processes used in transmission and dispatch operation will be an asset.
A period of up to 8 years experience in computer system administration is required.

Notes:
Applicants with lesser qualifications will also be considered at the lower salary level.
